medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient presented with symmetrical erythematous patch and painful ulcers on the lower extremities.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has a 7-year history of recurrent chronic livedoid vasculitis (LV). She complained of severe pain of the skin and numbness of the legs. Previous treatments included corticosteroids, aspirin, and Chinese medicine for local recurrence, but these were ineffective. After being prescribed oral aspirin, cyclosporine A, and minocycline for 1 month, which also proved ineffective, the patient experienced intense pain that affected her quality of life. After starting Adalimumab, there was progressive and rapid improvement of pain and erythema after 2 weeks, achieving almost complete remission after the third dose.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 7-year history of recurrent chronic livedoid vasculitis.
